UserPreferences.title: UserPreferences
UserPreferences.description: Stores user-specific settings and preferences, such as daily wake-up and sleep times, which define the active schedule for the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserPreferences entity.

wakeUpTime.description: The time of day the user typically wakes up, defining the start of their active schedule.

sleepTime.description: The time of day the user typically goes to sleep, defining the end of their active schedule.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents an individual task with details like title, multiple links, scheduled date and time, and completion status.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Task entity.

title.description: The main title or description of the task.

links.description: An optional array of objects containing a title and a URL.

date.description: The specific date the task is scheduled for.

time.description: The optional specific time of day the task is scheduled for.

completed.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the task has been marked as completed.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the task was originally created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the task was last updated or modified.

ownerId.description: The UID of the user who owns this task.

definition.description: Stores user-specific settings and preferences, such as daily wake-up and sleep times. This is a singleton document for each user, identified by 'profile' as its document ID. The ownership is implicitly tied to the '{userId}' in the path.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user who owns these preferences. Matches Firebase Authentication's request.auth.uid.

definition.description: Represents an individual task belonging to a specific user. Each document includes a denormalized 'ownerId' field, which matches the '{userId}' from the path, ensuring authorization independence and explicit ownership within the document itself.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user who owns this task. Matches Firebase Authentication's request.auth.uid.

params.name: taskId
params.description: The unique identifier for the individual task document.

firestore.reasoning: The recommended Firestore structure is designed to adhere strictly to the core design principles and strategy mandates, prioritizing authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. All data is structured under a top-level `/users/{userId}` collection to establish clear, path-based ownership, a cornerstone for secure and debuggable rules.
